pr_title: [ML] Add ModelLoadingService method for always caching models

timeline.bodyText:
This won't work in the long run.
What if the model is removed from a pipeline while loading?

Model A is referenced by a pipeline on this node
That model happens to fall out of cache
Data node says calls loadModelAndCache for model A
Pipeline is then deleted in the middle of loading it up
Data node gets Cancelling load of model [A] as it is no longer referenced by a pipeline failure

This type of complexity is one of the many reasons I think we need to move away from a cache based system and towards a deployment based system.
timeline.author: benwtrent

replies.bodyText:
Good point. I didn't want to add any more complexity to ModelLoadingService but adding this second use certainly does that. I thought I could split my usage out to a separate class but that then defeats the sharing the cache.
Regarding the error case you describe at least it will error and the listener will be notified rather than silently timing out.

This is probably ok as long as it never is intended for production.

Let's agree this feature branch will never be merged into master.  I agree the whole caching strategy is liable to change and there are many unanswered questions in general, which is kinda the point of doing this PoC.
